comments:
I can't use the content assist key, Ctr + Space, in the editor, because the Ctr + Space key is the Chinese Characters Input Method. How can I do? Please help me!

Thank you very much.

zhuge < zhuge@Rinaix.cn >
Moving to JDT Text
It's Alt+/ on a Chinese locale.

(In reply to comment #2)
> It's Alt+/ on a Chinese locale.
> 

I have tried it. But an Error Executing Command window activated. In the window, the error message was displayed: "The command for the key you pressed failed  Reason: The command for the key you pressed failed" .

(In reply to comment #1)
> Moving to JDT Text
> 

I don't know how to do moving to JDT Text. Please help me.

Thank you.

zhuge < zhuge@Rinaix.cn >

3.2 M4 is the latest stable build for 3.2 development. It contains new features but might be less stable than a release build. In addition you cannot use the update manager to upgrade to a development build - this only works for release builds.

The failures you see are out of memory. Give Eclipse more of it using "-vmargs -Xmx350M" (or some other number, depending on your machine's RAM size) . As an alternative you can simply download the and install the build (make sure not to copy over the existing install).

(In reply to comment #13)
> 3.2 M4 is the latest stable build for 3.2 development. It contains new features
> but might be less stable than a release build. In addition you cannot use the
> update manager to upgrade to a development build - this only works for release
> builds.
> 
> The failures you see are out of memory. Give Eclipse more of it using "-vmargs
> -Xmx350M" (or some other number, depending on your machine's RAM size) . As an
> alternative you can simply download the and install the build (make sure not to
> copy over the existing install).
> 

My machine's RAM size is 512M and its swap size is 1024M.  I used "-vmargs -Xmx500", but the out of memory error also occured. Then I downloaded and installed the 3.1.1 build. When I ran it by type ./eclipse within the installed directory, the error message, Error to open Workbench failed, was displayed. In the end, I downloaded and installed the 3.2M4 build and now it can run. I will study it in these time. Before I always used the SUN's NetBean IDE. I think I will turn to use Eclipse to do development in the future.

Thank you very much.

My machine's OS is FC4 (Fedora Core 4) and its locale is Chinese. Now I report the steps below:

1. download the 3.2M4 Build from command line: wget   
ftp://ftp.cise.ufl.edu/pub/mirrors/eclipse/eclipse/downloads/drops/S-3.2M4-200512151506/eclipse-SDK-3.2M4-linux-gtk.tar.gz

2. install it: tar  zxvf eclipse-SDK-3.2M4-linux-gtk.tar.gz

3. running it: eclipse/eclipse 

4. select a workspace from the Workspace Launcher: /home/zhuge/workspace2

5. new a Java Project, named helloWorld

6. new a Java Class, named hw, and its file name is hw.java

7. in the Editor, I can read the follow program and I see the cursor is at head of the first line:
public class hw {

	/**
	 * @param args
	 */
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
	}

}

8. I move the cursor to the 5th line( * @param args ), and at this time I see two lines at the 5th line position. Each line's content is the same, that is, * @param args.

9. I close the Editor by pressing CTRL + W.

10. I double click the main(String[]) from Pachage Explorer. And the Editor is opened again, and I see "7 : 28" (that means the cursor is at the 28th character of the 7th line, I think) from bottom of the Workbench. at this time I also see two lines at the 7th line.

11. I move the cursor to the last line, and move it to the first line. I do that 5 times. I hardly read the program. I close it again (CTRL+W).

12. open it again. and below of the 9th line, I type 3 lines, including two space lines):
     space line
     space line
     System.out.println("12345");

13. save them by pressing CTRL+S. at this time, the cursor jump up to the 9th line. I can NOT read the 12th line and the 9th line.

14. close it again (CTR+W).

15. open it again. at this time I can see two lines which content is System.out.println("12345");

16. move the cursor to the 12th line (watching the bottom of the workbench, or I do NOT know where the cursor goes).

17. toggle line breakpoint (SHIFT+CTRL+B);

18. run as java application (SHIFT+ALT+X J). "12345" is displayed in the Console.

19. debug as java application (SHIFT+ALT+D J). An error window activate within "Cannot connect to VM".

20. I change the launching timeout from 20000 to 200 or 20. debug it again. the result is the same as the 19th step.

21. In the end, I have to close the Eclipse with disappointment and very very bad mood.

Please help me!
